response.message: In the example screenshot in your post, does it mean that 7 people are actively subscribed to the RSS feed, that 7 users are receiving emails, or both?
@george right now the count is email only but it will include both within a few days.

One bit of feedback I would give is that the "subscribe" and "rss" links are a bit too close to each other - they look like they are a single link "subscribe rss".

I clicked on "subscribe" expecting to subscribe to the tag through RSS (as "subscribe rss" should do), but it subscribed via email.

Perhaps "subscribe" can be renamed to "email".
@jeremy agreed, Jin (our designer) brought that up too, and we'll change it
What's meant to be in the "excerpt" section? Do we write about about what topics the tag includes, or is this something else?

I just added a tag with the new "star" feature, but all my other favorite tags disappeared. I then added a lot of tags, but after 20 or perhaps 30 the favorite tags were reset and I ended up with only four. Is there a limit or some lurking bug?
Ok, I just checked again: My favorite tags are still there (verified by infavorites:mine), but only the last four are displayed at my profile page in the prefs tab.
Congratulations on finding a way to show FAQs that actually are FAQs and not a list of questions that someone things people will ask!
I for one like this feature.  Thanks Jeff and team SO.
This display doesn't show for my interesting tags (on the right). If it did it'd be easier to subscribe for them. :)
Might want to use a image for the star, does not display in FF3.6 on XP (English OS)

Windows XP has a limited system font by default.  You can obtain a unicode version of the default font by installing any of the products listed on this page (scroll to the bottom):  http://www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/font.aspx?FMID=1081 or by obtaining this font by other means.
@Geoff Dalgas: That's all fine and good, but I don't feel like bloating this OS any more than necessary just to display a single graphic on one website.
Wow, the name change really sucks.  There are thousands of references to Interesting Tags.  There will also be confusion between Favorite Questions, and Favorite Tags.
